name: Assembly of European Regions
goal:
The Assembly of European Regions (est.1985) is the largest independent network of regions in the wider Europe. Bringing together 150+ regions from 35 countries and 15 interregional organisations, AER's mission is to:
- Promote the principle of subsidiarity and regional democracy
- Increase the regions' political influence within the European institutions
- Support the regions in the process of European enlargement and globalisation
- Facilitate interregional cooperation across wider Europe and beyond
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Culture, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Public Health, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: All legislation with an impact at the regional level, more specifically in the fields of economy and regional development, cohesion policy, public health and social affairs, youth, culture, education, international cooperation, equal opportunities, institutional affairs.
